name: kaggle_scrape_notebook
description: Scrape a Kaggle notebook/code page. Returns title, author, code snippets, votes, comments count, and linked datasets. Note: Kaggle renders notebooks in an iframe so full code extraction may be limited.

steps.code: const title = document.querySelector('h1')?.textContent?.trim() || document.title.split('|')[0]?.trim() || ''; const authorEl = document.querySelector('a[href*="/code/"]')?.closest('div')?.querySelector('a[href^="/"]') || document.querySelector('a[href*="/users/"]'); const author = authorEl?.textContent?.trim() || ''; const codeCells = []; const outputCells = []; document.querySelectorAll('pre code, pre, .CodeMirror-code, [class*="code"] pre').forEach(el => { const text = el.textContent.trim(); if (text.length > 5 && text.length < 2000) codeCells.push(text.substring(0, 500)); }); document.querySelectorAll('[class*="output"] pre, [class*="Output"], [class*="result"]').forEach(el => { const text = el.textContent.trim(); if (text.length > 5) outputCells.push(text.substring(0, 300)); }); const datasets = []; document.querySelectorAll('a[href*="/datasets/"]').forEach(a => { const href = a.getAttribute('href'); if (href && href.match(/\/datasets\/[^/]+\/[^/]+/)) { datasets.push({ name: a.textContent.trim(), url: 'https://www.kaggle.com' + href }); } }); const allText = document.body.innerText; const votes = allText.match(/(\d+)\s*votes?/i)?.[1] || ''; const comments = allText.match(/(\d+)\s*comments?/i)?.[1] || ''; return { title, author, votes, comments, code_cells: codeCells.slice(0, 10), outputs: outputCells.slice(0, 5), linked_datasets: datasets.slice(0, 5), url: window.location.href };
steps.name: page_data
steps.label: Extract notebook data
